subSections.title: Readings
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|なり|yomi=k}}
From classical Japanese {{m|ja|なり|tr=nari}}, a contraction of {{m|ja|に|tr=ni}} and {{m|ja|あり|tr=ari}}.

subSections.title: Verb
subSections.text:
{{ja-verb|なり}}

# {{n-g|The classical Japanese copula “[[to be]]”, equivalent to modern Japanese {{m|ja|である|tr=de aru}} or {{m|ja|だ|tr=da}}.}}

subSections.title: Derived terms
Usage notes
subSections.text: The kanji form is usually used to denote a sum of money, e.g. {{m|ja|[[二]][[千]][[円]][[也]]|tr=nisen en nari}}. <!-- also in the Nyaruko OP "Koi wa KAOSU no Shimobe nari" -->
